official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide an exception for certain public-private
			 research arrangements from the business use test for purposes of
			 determining private activity bonds.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Exception to business use test for certain public-private research arrangements

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following
			 new paragraph:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: owned by a governmental unit or a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
organization enters into a bona fide, arm’s-length contractual
			 arrangement with a person other than a governmental unit or a

organization regarding the terms for sharing the economic benefits of any
			 products resulting from basic research, including arrangements in which
			 those economic terms (such as exclusive or non-exclusive licenses of
			 intellectual property and licensing fees or royalty rates) are determined
			 in advance at the time the parties enter into the contractual arrangement.

text.#text:
Paragraph (1) shall not apply to an issue if the proceeds of such issue are to be used under an
			 arrangement relating to basic research at a facility—

term.#tail:
means any original investigation for the advancement of scientific knowledge not having a specific
			 commercial objective.

text.#text: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term

The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to research agreements entered into after the date
			 of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5829 IH: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide an exception for certain public-private research arrangements from the business use test for purposes of determining private activity bonds.
